page.title: 02RELIGION OF DACRE CHURCH.
page.content: Dacre church is dedicated to St.Andrew and stands on the site of a Saxon monastery.It's architecture varies from Norman to Early English and the last restoration was done in 1870.There are two main services at 8.00am and 10.45am.On average there are 8 funerals,6 weddings 12 baptisms and 1 confirmation group per year.Some changes in the past 25 years are; a new organ,the congregation has grown and in 1982 the three bells were taken down and rehung.The vicar's name is Rev.K.H.Smith.The organist is Mr.M.D. Irving.There are 4 churchwardens and 12 cleaners who clean the church every Thursday.There have been 28 vicars to date.The corners of the graveyard are marked by stone figures the"Dacre Bears" whose origin is unknown.At Christmas Rev.Smith takes carol singing in the local public houses.
